alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 4:52PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Carbon and southwestern Albany Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 450 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bow River Campground to near Sugar Loaf Campground. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong crosswinds along Interstate 80 near Arlington and Elk Mountain could be hazardous to light, high-profile vehicles. Locations impacted include... Elk Mountain, Brooklyn Lake, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Sugar Loaf Campground, Libby Creek Campground, Bow River Campground, Deep Creek Campground, Rob Roy Campground, Centennial, Nash Fork Campground, Rob Roy Reservoir, North Fork Campground and Arlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin
